text: The Yilan Line () is the northern section of the Eastern Line of the Taiwan Railway Administration in Taiwan. It has a length of 95 km.Taiwan Railways Administration == History == This railroad was completed in 1924 as the Giran- sen during Imperial Japanese rule over Taiwan. It was expanded to two tracks in the early 1980s. In 2000, it was electrified between Badu and Luodong. The remaining part was completed in 2003. == Stations == Train passing through the rural Sandiaoling Station {|class=wikitable style="text-align:center" !Name!!Chinese!!Taiwanese!!Hakka!!Transfers and
